html: This so-called attempt to "save the internet" is a gift to edge providers who want to market personal data. GOP members have introduced three bills that would protect consumers without government involvement – let’s focus our attention on those practical solutions instead.
text: This so-called attempt to "save the internet" is a gift to edge providers who want to market personal data. GOP members have introduced three bills that would protect consumers without government involvement – let’s focus our attention on those practical solutions instead.

html: This isn’t the first time we’ve debated net neutrality. When Trump first announced he was repealing regulations, liberals wouldn't stop talking about how this would radically change the internet as we knew it. But when the regulations ceased, these doomsday predictions fell flat.
text: This isn’t the first time we’ve debated net neutrality. When Trump first announced he was repealing regulations, liberals wouldn't stop talking about how this would radically change the internet as we knew it. But when the regulations ceased, these doomsday predictions fell flat.

html: I support the bipartisan and commonsense "bright line" rules for net neutrality – no blocking, no throttling and no paid prioritization – that protect consumers, but the Save the Internet Act reaches far beyond these commonsense protections.
text: I support the bipartisan and commonsense "bright line" rules for net neutrality – no blocking, no throttling and no paid prioritization – that protect consumers, but the Save the Internet Act reaches far beyond these commonsense protections.

html: The internet isn’t broken, so why are liberals trying to fix it? In H.R. 1644, House Democrats want to give federal entities nearly unlimited authority to regulate the internet, which is why I voted against it.
text: The internet isn’t broken, so why are liberals trying to fix it? In H.R. 1644, House Democrats want to give federal entities nearly unlimited authority to regulate the internet, which is why I voted against it.

html: For #FeaturedFemaleFriday, we're celebrating Dorothy Shaver from Mena. Ms. Shaver became president of Lord & Taylor in 1945 with a $110,000 salary, the highest salary for an American woman at the time. By 1947, Ms. Shaver was managing a $40 million business. #WomensHistoryMonthpic.twitter.com/Z33Wv1mNk3

For #FeaturedFemaleFriday, we're celebrating Dorothy Shaver from Mena. Ms. Shaver became president of Lord & Taylor in 1945 with a $110,000 salary, the highest salary for an American woman at the time.

html: #DYK there are 360M acres of privately-owned working forests in the US? html: The last several wildfire seasons have resulted in devastation in states across the Western and Southeastern United States. html: SPREAD THE WORD! Jack Cook of Arkansas died in WW2 when he gave up his spot in a life boat to save another man. We're trying to track down his family to ensure he receives a posthumous award! @DrewPetrimoulx reports. #ARNews @RepWestermanpic.twitter.com/3tkOzo8t0U
text:
SPREAD THE WORD! 

Jack Cook of Arkansas died in WW2 when he gave up his spot in a life boat to save another man.  

We're trying to track down his family to ensure he receives a posthumous award!  @DrewPetrimoulx reports. #ARNews @RepWestermanpic.twitter.com/3tkOzo8t0U

html: During my visit to Fordyce this afternoon, I stopped by Havoc Boats and saw the impressive work being done by its more than 50 employees. I also donned a fedora in honor of Fordyce’s most famous native, Coach Bear Bryant, and talked safety with local law enforcement. #ar4pic.twitter.com/rdIizfj99j

html: The Arkansas Dept. of Veterans Affairs paid tribute to the veterans of the Vietnam War today, 50 years after it began. I join with all Arkansans today honoring Vietnam Veterans for your service and sacrifice. To the families of those killed in action, we honor their memory. #ar4pic.twitter.com/tF3M46osa4
